result.adr_address: Yelyzavety Chavdar St, 18, Kyiv, Ukraine, 02140
result.name: Молоко від фермера

reviews.text: It's a shame you turned off your hotline as I sincerely wanted to let you know the level of my disappointment with today's purchase. I bought half of a coconut cake in your store at the address of Kyiv, str. Chavdar, 18, the seller assured that the cake was from yesterday. I paid almost UAH 500 for this good thing for a second! I came to your place specifically from Boryspil, because this is my husband's favorite cake. After trying your cake at home, it turned out that the top layer of the cream is completely sour... that is, spoiled!!! I just have no words...

If there were 0 stars, they would give zero. We came here to buy a casserole a couple of months ago, the casserole became moldy in the refrigerator the very next day (even though the “expiration date” was supposed to expire in a week). Well, that’s okay, it happens. We came to the store to sort it out and return the money for the dishonest product - to put it mildly, we were “sent.” The saleswoman “doesn’t know anything”, she “didn’t sell us such things”, it’s a circus. I called my boss and got half the words wrong. We agreed to call us back when they spoke with the supplier. Naturally, no one called.
Disgusting service and service.

The store is a fake in all respects, it is supposedly a store Milk from a farmer, and inside everything is like in this network, but the name is Farmer (this store is not on the website of the network Milk from a farmer). Prices for the same items here are twice as high. But that's all fluff, I bought sour-milk cheese from them, and it turned out to be a surrogate, it tasted like plasticine, checking with a drop of iodine - the cheese turned purple-blue. I don't know who the owners of his store are, but the degree of their arrogance is simply off the charts and they clearly need to be checked by the relevant authorities.

Good afternoon, there are no words.
I bought products at the Farmer store on Chavdar.
First of all, it is expensive, but there are also no deadlines, where are the consumer authorities looking. How is it possible to trade in arrears, every product has a deadline until which time it can be used.
Maybe consumer authorities will start to check what these points sell.

It is a pity, but the product was sold for the second time with a corrected expiration date. Dear buyers, be careful, because this is a DAIRY product, and various pathogenic bacteria grow there very quickly.
